instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging
threads.message:
Hi guys i have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had a corroded <CAPACITOR>C7156</CAPACITOR> and little burn damage in the board, made a wire from pin 1 to pin 1 from <CAPACITOR>C7562</CAPACITOR> and that seem to have done the job as I got fanspin. I dont get orange light though. I do have 3.42v, PPBUS is 12.31V with and without battery connected. I get fanspin with battery connected when I connect magsafe. When disconnect magsafe it can keep runing on battery alone. When only the battery is connected shorting <CAPACITOR>C5710</CAPACITOR> will not start it up.

I replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> same result
Resistance between pin 17/18 <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> = 3ohm
Between 27/28 = 20ohm
<RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> is 2K and <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> is 2Kohm

When turned on I have 3.43v on both pins of <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR>
On <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> pin 1 = 3.43 and on pin two it switches between 3.43 and 0.2 not sure what it should be?SMC area looks pretty neat so havent done anything yet, like reflow.

What more to check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging
threads.message:
Resistance to ground on SCL/SDA lines?
<RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> is OK?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> battery not charging
threads.message: What 2inform said also inspect battery connector and the BIL for corrosion. Also could be crap under the SMC pulling it low not bad to run flux under to clear out crap
